title: Sergio Aguero starts for Manchester City while Yaya Toure is dropped to the bench for Champions League clash at Monaco

Sergio Aguero starts for Manchester City in their Champions League last 16 second leg at Monaco . 
There had been talk before the game that the wantaway City striker would be benched, but he retains his starting place in Gabriel Jesus' absence. 
Yaya Toure is the noticeable omission , losing his place in midfield as Fernandinho returns having been on the bench for the FA Cup win at Middlesbrough on Saturday. 
There are other changes as Bacary Sagna comes in for Pablo Zabaleta at right-back while Nicolas Otamendi is also benched, replaced by Aleksandar Kolarov at centre-back. 
Meanwhile there is a big boost for City with Radamel Falcao, scorer of two goals in the first leg at the Etihad Stadium, not making tonight's squad due to a hip injury. 
Falcao has plundered 21 goals this season and his enforced loss is a huge blow for Monaco as they look to overturn a 5-3 deficit from the first leg. 
Pep Guardiola has promised another goal glut following City’s 5-3 win in the first leg, in which they twice came from behind. (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) (Photo: Stu Forster) 
The City boss is convinced his side can win the Champions League playing in a cavalier style and says he cannot play any other way. 
“Can we win the Champions League in that way? Yes, sure,” said Guardiola. 
“It’s the only way I know and it’s going to be another fantastic game. 
City manager Pep Guardiola has insisted his side will go for broke at the Stade Louis II in their bid to reach the last eight for a second consecutive season. 
The Spaniard is convinced his side can become kings of Europe playing in a cavalier style and says he cannot play any other way. 
Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says he will not be thinking of personal glory in Champions League 
“Can we win the Champions League in that way? Yes, sure,” said Guardiola. “It’s the only way I know and it’s going to be another fantastic game. 
“Monaco are a team created to attack and our team is created to attack - or at least to score goals. So in that way it will be a great game.” 
Man City: Caballero, Sagna, Stones, Kolarov, Clichy, Fernandinho, Sterling, Silva, De Bruyne, Sané, Agüero.
